thread.title: Aaron Loup will miss Game 5 to deal with off-field issue [Video]
thread.title_full: Aaron Loup will miss Game 5 to deal with off-field issue [Video]

title: Aaron Loup will miss Game 5 to deal with off-field issue [Video]
text:
Celebrate food, drink and the Jays 
With Aaron Loup unable to pitch Wednesday due family matters and Brett Cecil out with injury, Blue Jays manager John Gibbons will have a short-handed bullpen at his disposal against the Texas Rangers in Game 5 of the ALDS. 
Gibbons confirmed today that Loup, who has pitched just one inning this postseason, will be unavailable to the team. 
But the manager says the rest of his staff will just have to step up. 
'What are you going to do?” Gibbons said. “It just means somebody else has got to step up. Our guys are fully capable of that. 
“There's no doubt that Cecil (who tore a calf muscle in Game 2 and is done of the season) going down was a blow. We feel good with what we have right now. We've got a lot of relievers that are throwing really well right now.” 
Gibbons also said that he doesn't plan to use David Price, no matter what the situation, given the workload he's already had this series. 
Like most of the team — not to mention the city and country — Gibbons is hoping the Jays bats perform more like they did in Games 3 and 4 in Texas than the first two here. 
“We felt terrible going down to Dallas, but the fact that we got it back here, we're feeling good, as we should. We're probably as confidence as we can be, so we've still got to go out and play it.”
